page.title: 17Local news in Bristol
page.content: In south Bristol's Windmill City farm there is going to be a floodlit football pitch which will cost Â£34,000 Weatherman Francis Wilson from Breakfast T.V. took off to the skies in an airship and flew over Bristol at an altitude of 1,000 feet. He did all this to find out about the local weather. A house in Coates Walk was burgled and a camera worth Â£300 was stolen. Two days before this incident there was another burglary in Dunster Road where cash and jewellery were stolen to the value of Â£500. On 26th July l985 the Queen and Duke of Edinburgh will travel in the Royal Barge across Bristol Docks to the{ {Maritime Heritage Centre, }after which there will be a huge firework display on Brandon Hill.
